CatDescriptText: W.R. Brown, job analyst, Monroeville and Elias Howard, coffee shop employe[e], Garfield were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, January 30, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Are you in favor of increasing the city wage tax to pay salaries for additional police officers in Pittsburgh?  Say, about 500 more?"  Mr. Brown's answer reads: " The cops should be getting more. If it takes a little more wage tax, then you will have to pay it." Mr. Howard's answer reads: "Additional police are needed, but I wouldn't increase the wage tax because it's too hard now on persons who draw low wages."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of W.R. Brown wearing light colored fedora, grid patterned bow tie, and light colored overcoat, standing in front of flecked building, Downtown; Portrait of Elias Howard wearing dark ribbed zippered jacket, standing in front of flecked building, Downtown
